item.title: This Indian CEO Is The Highest-Paid Employee In The World; This Is His Salary... - News18
item.description:
Jagdeep Singh: The Highest-Paid CEO in the World

Date: January 02, 2025 Source: News18

Jagdeep Singh holds the title for the highest annual salary in the world at Rs 17,500 crore, with earnings that reflect his significant impact on the evolving landscape of wealth and technology.

  • Singh earns an astonishing Rs 48 crore per day, surpassing the annual revenue of many corporations.
  • He is the founder of Quantumscape, a leader in electric car battery technology.
  • Singh's monthly income stands at Rs 1,459 crore, setting a new benchmark for salary globally.
  • His academic background includes a B.Tech from Stanford University and an MBA from the University of California.
  • Quantumscape is driving innovations in electric vehicle technology, contributing to sustainable transportation.
  • Singh's journey from an employee to a CEO exemplifies the potential of entrepreneurship and innovation.
“Singh is King,” reflecting the pride in his achievement as the highest-paid employee worldwide.

Jagdeep Singh’s story serves as an inspiration for aspiring entrepreneurs, highlighting the intersection of technology, opportunity, and financial success.

item.title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO Day 3 Live Updates: Issue subscribed 229.68 times on third day; check latest GMP | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO Day 3 Live Updates: Issue Subscribed 229.68 Times

Publication Date: 02 Jan, 2025

Source: LiveMint

The Indo Farm Equipment IPO saw exceptional demand, closing with an oversubscription of over 229 times on the final day of bidding. This article provides the details and implications of the IPO, which aims to raise significant capital for business expansion and debt reduction.

  • IPO subscription was strong, with bids for 1.94 billion shares against 847,000 shares on offer.
  • The price band for the IPO is set between ₹204 and ₹215 per share, targeting to raise ₹260.15 crore.
  • The QIB segment attracted a subscription of 242.40 times, while NII was subscribed 503.83 times.
  • Indo Farm Equipment's strategic plans include expanding production capacity and reducing debt.
“At the upper end of the price band, the company aims to raise ₹260.15 crore from the book-built issue.”

This IPO is seen as a strong investment opportunity, backed by the company’s growth strategy and market position.

item.title: DMart battles quick commerce, grows revenue by 17% on year to Rs 15,565 crore - Moneycontrol
item.description:
DMart Battles Quick Commerce with 17% Revenue Growth

Date: January 02, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

DMart-owner Avenue Supermarts reported a standalone revenue of Rs 15,565.23 crore for the September quarter, marking a 17.5% year-on-year increase. The company continues to face pressures from online grocery competitors.

  • Revenue from operations reached Rs 15,565 crore, a 17.5% increase compared to the same period last year.
  • Total store count as of December was 387, with the addition of 10 new stores in the third quarter.
  • Shares of Avenue Supermarts saw a 1.4% increase on January 2.
  • Despite growth, the company faced challenges from quick commerce and online grocery formats influencing operations.
“The operations were impacted by online grocery format players, including the rapid growth of quick commerce as a delivery model.”

In conclusion, while DMart shows resilient revenue growth, the company's performance indicates a competitive landscape influenced by the rapid rise of quick commerce.

item.title: Sebi rejects Zee, Punit Goenka's settlement applications, orders further probe - The Economic Times
item.description:
Sebi Rejects Settlement Applications from Zee Entertainment and Punit Goenka

Date: January 2, 2023

Source: Economic Times

The Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) has dismissed the settlement applications filed by Zee Entertainment Enterprises and its CEO Punit Goenka, ordering further investigation into the matter.

  • Sebi's decision followed the review of show cause notices against Zee and its executives for alleged violations.
  • The ongoing investigation will now include previously issued allegations as part of its broader inquiry.
  • Shares of Zee have significantly declined, down nearly 60% in the past year following a terminated deal with Sony.
"The allegations in the SCN dated July 06, 2022 issued by AO are to be subsumed with the findings of the further investigation carried out by SEBI in the instant matter." - Sebi Order

In conclusion, with the rejection of settlement applications, the investigation into Zee Entertainment and its executives will continue, potentially leading to further regulatory actions.

item.title: Waaree Energies to NTPC Green: Check how renewable energy stocks performed in 2024 and the sector outlook for 2025 - Upstox
item.description:
Performance of Renewable Energy Stocks in India: 2024 Insights and 2025 Outlook

Publication Date: January 3, 2025 Source: PTI

As India aims to enhance its green energy capacity, renewable energy stocks witnessed varied performances in 2024, with significant implications for 2025's outlook.

Key Points

  • Adani Green Energy: Shares dropped 35% due to allegations against chairman Gautam Adani, closing 2024 at ₹1,040.7.
  • Suzlon Energy: Shares rose 61.6%, bolstered by strong order flows, closing at ₹62.22.
  • Waaree Energies: Strong orders led to an 89% increase since listing, closing at ₹2,854.6.
  • Premier Energies: Jumped over 60%, closing at ₹1,353.1, backed by substantial contracts.
  • NTPC Green Energy: Rose 14.5% since listing, reaching ₹127.67 with significant project bids.
  • KPI Green Energy: Increased over 66%, closing at ₹815.15, projecting 10GW capacity by 2030.

Key Sector Triggers

  • Renewable energy capacity additions reached 24.72 GW in 2024, led by solar power.
  • The government pledged ₹32.45 lakh crore for renewable energy projects.
  • Growth factors include emerging technologies and rising demand for solar components.

Outlook for 2025

  • Projected capacity addition of 35 GW in 2025.
  • Government initiatives like PM Surya Ghar Muft Bijli Yojana to support solar projects.
  • Wind energy sector expected to see double-digit growth.

item.title: Europe and Asia's factories end 2024 on weak footing as Trump 2.0 risks mount - Reuters
item.description:
Europe and Asia's factories end 2024 on weak footing as Trump 2.0 risks mount

Date: Jan 2, 2025 | Source: Reuters

Factory activity in Asia and Europe ended 2024 on a soft note due to rising trade tensions linked to a possible second term for Donald Trump and the ongoing economic struggles in China.

  • European manufacturing activity fell sharply in December.
  • Asia's factory activity slows amid weak Chinese demand.
  • Trump's tariff threats are impacting major trading partners.
  • Taiwan sees growth, while South Korea and Japan face declines.
“Output in the euro zone remained under pressure at the end of 2024, held back by a continued slide in new orders in both the domestic market and in exports.” - Claus Vistesen, chief euro zone economist at Pantheon.

The decline in factory activity points to a challenging economic landscape as stakeholders brace for potential tariff increases and slow recovery in major economies.

item.description:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO Day 3 Live Updates: Issue Subscribed Over 227 Times

Date: January 2, 2025 Source: HT Digital Streams Limited

The Indo Farm Equipment IPO is attracting strong interest as it enters its final day, having been heavily oversubscribed. The IPO price band is set between ₹204 and ₹215, with plans to raise ₹260.15 crore.

  • Subscription status indicates the IPO has been oversubscribed over 227 times.

This IPO reflects positive market sentiment towards agricultural machinery investments, indicating potential growth for Indo Farm Equipment in coming years.

item.title: Take A Look At The Hyundai Creta Electric In These 10 Images - CarDekho
item.description:
Hyundai Creta Electric (Creta EV) Explained In 10 Images

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: CarDekho.com

The Hyundai Creta Electric has been unveiled as the most affordable electric vehicle from Hyundai in India. It retains much of the design language from the regular Creta but includes specific features tailored for EV performance.

  • Redesigned front fascia with a new pixelated pattern replacing the conventional grille.
  • Aerodynamically styled 17-inch alloy wheels.
  • Available with two battery pack options: 42 kWh (Medium Range) and 51.4 kWh (Long Range).
  • ARAI-claimed ranges of 390 km for the medium range and 473 km for the long range.
  • Fast charging capabilities: 10-80% in just 58 minutes with a DC fast charger.
  • Expected starting price of Rs 20 lakh (ex-showroom).
“The Creta Electric can be charged to 100% in approximately 4 hours using an 11 kW AC charger.”

The Creta Electric is set to compete with other electric SUVs such as Tata Curvv EV and Mahindra BE 6, marking a significant entry into the growing electric vehicle market in India.

item.title: Top Gainers and Losers today on 2 January, 2025: Eicher Motors, Bajaj Finserv, Sun Pharmaceutical Industries, Britannia Industries among most active stocks; Check full list here | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:

Source: Live Mint

The Nifty index closed at 23,742.9, marking a rise of 1.88%. Active stocks included Eicher Motors and Bajaj Finserv among the top gainers, while Sun Pharmaceutical Industries and Britannia Industries were the main losers.

Key Points:

  • Top gainers in Nifty: Eicher Motors (+8.65%), Bajaj Finserv (+7.88%); Top losers: Sun Pharma (-0.63%), Britannia (-0.14%).

For a more detailed overview, check the lists of top gainers and losers.

item.title: Transfer Of Property Act : Important Supreme Court Judgments Of 2024 - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Transfer Of Property Act: Important Supreme Court Judgments Of 2024

Publication Date: 2024 | Source: LiveLaw

This article highlights significant Supreme Court rulings related to the Transfer of Property Act in 2024, showcasing essential legal principles regarding property rights, contracts, and more.

  • If a deed is executed by someone without title, successors cannot enforce rights based on it.
  • Changes made unilaterally in a registered sale deed after execution are invalid.
  • Complete sale of a debtor's property is impermissible if a part satisfies the decree.
  • The doctrine of lis pendens does not invalidate a sale deed executed during a pending lawsuit.
  • State property rights must be sold through a fair auction, not at nominal prices.
  • Conditions to invoke the Transfer of Property Act outlined by the Supreme Court.
  • Lis pendens applies as soon as a petition is filed, not when a court notice is given.
  • A buyer cannot claim bona fide purchaser status if aware of lis pendens.
  • A minor can receive immovable property through a sale deed.
  • Possessing property under specific conditions does not change the nature of the mortgage.
  • Lis pendens principles apply even when Section 52 is not applicable in certain states.
  • Title deeds can secure debts, establishing an equitable mortgage.
  • A gift deed cannot be revoked if no right of revocation is reserved.
  • Courts can invalidate sales carried out during proceedings as part of contempt power.
  • A co-owner without clear share cannot transfer the entire property.
“The rights of the State as the lessor can only be sold by a public auction or by any other transparent method…”

In conclusion, these rulings encapsulate crucial interpretations of property law that landowners, purchasers, and legal practitioners must navigate in 2024.

item.title: Is Zomato Delivering ‘Girlfriends’ Now? Over 4,000 People Searched For It On New Year’s Eve - News18
item.description:
Is Zomato Delivering ‘Girlfriends’ Now? Over 4,000 People Searched For It On New Year’s Eve

Date: January 02, 2025 Source: News18

On New Year’s Eve, Zomato reported that 4,940 people searched for 'girlfriend' on the app, and 40 users searched for 'bride'. These humorous searches reflect the festive mood and the creative use of food delivery apps among individuals away from home.

  • 4,940 searches for 'girlfriend' on Zomato on New Year’s Eve.
  • 40 searches for 'bride'.
  • Possible explanation related to the names of restaurants 'Girlfriend Food Court' and 'Girlfriend Arabian Mandi Restaurant'.
  • Humorous social media reactions suggest a playful interpretation of the searches.
“People are not as stupid as they are being shown to be.” - Mustafa Khundmiri on X

This light-hearted trend on Zomato highlights how food delivery apps are being utilized in unexpected ways, prompting both amusement and discussion online.

item.title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO Day 3 Live Updates: Issue subscribed over 199 times so far; check GMP. Apply or not? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO Day 3 Live Updates: Issue subscribed over 220 times so far; check GMP. Apply or not?

Date: 02 Jan, 2025

Source: LiveMint

The Indo Farm Equipment IPO has captured a significant interest from investors, being heavily oversubscribed with only a day left for bidding. The IPO offers shares at a price band of ₹204 to ₹215.

  • The IPO commenced on December 31 and will conclude on January 2.
  • The company aims to raise ₹260.15 crore from the IPO.
  • As of now, the IPO is subscribed over 220 times.

Investors are urged to consider their long-term investment strategy before deciding on participation in the IPO.

item.title: Stock Market Rally: Why did the Nifty jump 450 points on Thursday? Key factors, contributors explained - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Stock Market Rally: Why did the Nifty jump 450 points on Thursday? Key factors, contributors explained

Date: January 2, 2025 Source: CNBC TV18

The Nifty index experienced its largest single-day gain in six weeks, rising by 450 points on a day characterized by significant market movements and foreign investor positioning.

  • The Nifty gained nearly 500 points during the trading session, closing at 24,168, after hitting an intraday high of 24,226.
  • Key factors include low net longs among Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) and the expiry of Nifty options contracts, triggering short-covering.
  • Positive commentary from brokerages like Bernstein encouraged buying in Indian stocks.
“Selectively start buying Indian stocks.” – Bernstein

The rally is expected to influence market sentiment positively, with key contributors such as Infosys and Bajaj Finance showing notable gains.

item.title: New Kia Syros India Launch On February 1, Deliveries To Commence Shortly After Price Announcement - CarDekho
item.description:
Kia Syros Launch on February 1 with Deliveries Shortly After

Publication Date: January 2025 | Source: CarDekho.com

Kia has confirmed the launch date of the Syros, a premium sub-4m SUV, which will be available starting February 1, 2025, with deliveries set to begin mid-February.

  • Prices to be revealed on February 1, 2025, with deliveries commencing shortly thereafter.
  • Available in six variants: HTK, HTK (O), HTK Plus, HTX, HTX Plus, and HTX Plus (O).
  • Features modern aesthetics like 3-pod LED headlights and flush-type door handles.
  • Interior includes a dual-tone theme and advanced features like dual 12.3-inch screens.
  • Safety kit comprises standard six airbags, a 360-degree camera, and level 2 ADAS.
  • Engine options include a 1-litre turbo-petrol and a 1.5-litre diesel from the Kia Sonet.
  • Expected starting price of Rs 9.70 lakh (ex-showroom).

The Kia Syros was unveiled in December 2024 as a new entry in Kia’s SUV lineup in India, aiming to blend contemporary design and safety features into a compact form.

item.title: Honda Cars India Reports 20 Percent Sales Growth In 2024 - NDTV
item.description:
Honda Cars India Reports 20 Percent Sales Growth In 2024

Publication Date: 2024

Source: Honda Cars India Ltd

Honda Cars India Ltd has concluded the year 2024 with a remarkable 20 percent growth in total sales, surpassing the previous year's totals.

  • Total sales reached 1.32 lakh units in 2024, up from 1.10 lakh units in 2023.
  • Domestic sales accounted for 68,650 units, while exports were at 63,221 units.
  • December 2024 sales were 5,603 units, a 35% increase from December 2023.
  • Challenges in the domestic market were noted, attributed to uneven demand.
  • Record exports, particularly of the mid-size SUV Honda Elevate, contributed significantly to growth.
Kunal Behl, Vice President, Marketing & Sales, stated, "2024 was a mixed bag for the industry... This contributed to a remarkable growth of 20% in overall HCIL's sales."

The performance indicates a strong focus on exports and the introduction of new models, positioning Honda as a significant player in India's automotive market.

item.title: Vodafone Idea 5G Launch in 2025? Time to BUY Vi stock - Target price - ET Now
item.description:
Vodafone Idea Plans 5G Launch by March 2025 – Stock Target at Rs 13

Updated: January 2, 2025 14:46 IST

Vodafone Idea (Vi) is set to launch its 5G mobile broadband service by March 2025, targeting high-demand areas to compete with rivals Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel.

  • 5G will be rolled out in 75 cities across 17 priority circles.
  • Plans may be up to 15% cheaper than competitors, potentially igniting a price war.
  • The company aims to enhance its 4G coverage alongside the launch of 5G.
  • CEO Akshaya Moondra indicated final pricing would be decided closer to launch.
  • Vodafone Idea recently secured Rs 24,000 crore in equity funding.
  • They plan to deploy 75,000 5G sites over the next three years.
  • Citi maintains a 'Buy/High Risk' rating, projecting a target price of Rs 13 per share.
“Clarity on debt funding will be a key catalyst for the stock's performance going ahead.”

As Vodafone Idea prepares for its ambitious expansion into 5G, the telecom market may witness significant shifts in competitive strategies and pricing.

item.title: Petronet LNG clarifies on the PNGRB paper on Dahej terminal; here's what it said - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Petronet LNG Responds to PNGRB's Regulatory Concerns on Dahej Terminal

Date: Jan 2, 2025 Source: CNBC-TV18

Petronet LNG Ltd. clarified its position regarding a recent paper from the Petroleum and Natural Gas Regulatory Board (PNGRB), stating that LNG terminal regulation requires amendments to the PNGRB Act of 2006.

  • PNGRB indicated that regulatory oversight of LNG terminals is necessary to ensure fair pricing and transparency.
  • Petronet LNG highlighted that its Dahej terminal has competitive regas charges, constituting only 5-6% of the delivered gas price.
  • The company reported an annual 5% increase in regas charges amid rising capacity utilization.
  • Citi brokerage recommended a 'Sell' for Petronet LNG, citing regulatory risks and competitiveness.
  • Shares of Petronet LNG dropped 5.49% to ₹328.50 following the concerns raised.
“Increasing competition adds to the uncertainty on the sustainability of Petronet LNG's historically strong pricing power.” - Citi Brokerage

The clarification aims to address concerns raised by PNGRB about the company's pricing structure amidst regulatory scrutiny.

item.title: Jai Corp shares hit 20% lower circuit, plunge to 52-week low amid capital reduction proposal by subsidiary UIHPL | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Jai Corp Shares Plunge to 52-Week Low Following Capital Reduction Proposal

Date: January 2, 2024 | Source: Live Mint

Jai Corp shares saw a significant drop, hitting a 52-week low after an announcement by its subsidiary UIHPL concerning a capital reduction.

Proposed Capital Reduction Details

UIHPL is seeking approval for a capital reduction that could provide Jai Corp with approximately ₹364 crore.

Recent Developments in UIHPL and Subsidiaries

UIHPL's subsidiary DIPL recently sold a major stake, resulting in increased funds for the proposed capital reduction.

Jai Corp’s Recent Buyback Program

The company had conducted a buyback of shares in September 2024, affecting shareholding dynamics.

Stock Price Trend

Currently, Jai Corp's stock is significantly down from its previous high, reflecting poor performance over the past year.

item.title: Petronet LNG share price: PSU issues CLARIFICATION after stock tanks over 8% - ET Now
item.description:
Petronet LNG Stock Drops 8% Amid Regulatory Concerns

Updated: January 2, 2025 | Source: ET NOW DIGITAL

Petronet LNG's shares fell 8.5% on January 2, 2025, following critical remarks from the Petroleum and Natural Gas Regulatory Board (PNGRB) regarding its tariffs.

  • Shares dropped to Rs 317.80 before slightly recovering to Rs 323.05.
  • Citi issued a bearish note, placing the stock under a 90-day negative watch.
  • Petronet LNG clarifies that current regulation does not fall under PNGRB's purview.
  • Regulatory criticism focuses on tariff increases without sharing benefits with consumers.
  • Citi sets a target price of Rs 310 for Petronet LNG, indicating a potential 11% downside.
Petronet LNG has delivered 46% positive return over the past year.

This situation highlights ongoing regulatory risks and the impact on market perceptions for Petronet LNG.
